articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Patricia Zengerle, Steve Holland
articles.description: The Biden administration has decided to lift a ban on U.S. sales of offensive weapons to Saudi Arabia, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday, reversing a three-year-old policy to pressure the Kingdom to wind down the Yemen war.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to lift ban on offensive weapons sales to Saudi Arabia, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane with 62 people on board crashed in Vinhedo, Brazil, on Friday, local TV station GloboNews reported.
articles.title: Plane crashes in Brazil with 62 people on board, local media reports

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: Ukrainian volunteers evacuated dozens of residents, and their pets, from northern Sumy region in anticipation of more Russian attacks in response to Ukraine's cross-border military incursion into the Kursk region.
articles.title: Ukraine volunteers evacuate residents near Russia's embattled Kursk region
Harris campaigns in Arizona, while Trump is in Montana

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran is set to carry out an order by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei to "harshly punish" Israel over the assassination of a Hamas leader in Tehran, a Revolutionary Guards deputy commander was quoted as saying on Friday by local news agencies.
articles.title: Iran set to carry out leader's order to 'harshly punish' Israel, Guards deputy chief says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: When war last came to the edges of Lebanon's capital nearly two decades ago, Bilal Sahlab drove his family to a secluded mountain town, rented an apartment and waited out the bombing.
articles.title: As war drums beat, those in Beirut suburb have nowhere to flee

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. embassy in Mexico said on Friday that Joaquin Guzman Lopez, the son of the infamous cartel kingpin "El Chapo," had surrendered voluntarily while his father's former partner Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada seemed to have been taken against his will.
articles.title: US says El Chapo's son surrendered but El Mayo taken against his will

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Washington will provide Israel $3.5 billion to spend on U.S. weapons and military equipment, the State Department said on Friday, with the release of the money coming months after the U.S. Congress appropriated it during Israel's war in Gaza.
articles.title: US releases $3.5 billion to Israel to spend on US weapons, military equipment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An oilseed workers strike in Argentina is set to carry on into Saturday as wage negotiations with firms remained stalled, affecting shipments from one of the world's major grain exporters.
articles.title: Argentina grains workers strike set to drag on into weekend

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 100 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded in an Israeli strike on a Gaza school sheltering displaced people, the official Palestinian news agency said on Saturday, while the Israeli army said it had hit a Hamas command centre.
articles.title: Israel strike on Gaza school kills more than 100, Palestinian news agency says
